insights.irregularityDetected: Your last cycle ({{lastCycle}} days) differs significantly from your average ({{avg}} days). This variation can be normal, but consider tracking symptoms or consulting a healthcare provider if it persists.
insights.predictionExplanation: Predictions are based on your {{count}} logged period(s). We calculate the median cycle length and use that to predict your next period. The date range accounts for natural cycle variation.

learn.title: Learn
learn.disclaimer: Educational information only. This is not medical advice.

cycleBasics.title: Cycle basics: the main phases
cycleBasics.body:
TL;DR
• Cycles have phases that can affect mood and energy
• Tracking helps you learn your pattern

What’s common
Menstrual: bleeding days. Follicular: energy may rise as the body prepares an egg. Ovulation: egg release mid-cycle. Luteal: the body prepares for the next period; PMS can appear.

What to track in Lalin
• Period start/end, flow, and notes
• Symptoms and mood changes

When to seek care
If pain is severe, bleeding is very heavy, or symptoms disrupt daily life.

trackingTips.title: Tracking tips that help
trackingTips.body:
TL;DR
• Consistent logs improve insights and predictions
• Notes help you spot triggers (stress, travel, illness)

What to do
• Log period start date (most important)
• Add end date if you know it
• Log symptoms, mood, and notes

What to look for
• Changes in timing, flow, pain, or mood
• Patterns across months (not just one cycle)

When to seek care
If you have a sudden change that lasts several cycles or symptoms that feel severe or new.

cycleLengthAndIrregularity.title: Cycle length and irregular cycles
cycleLengthAndIrregularity.body:
TL;DR
• Some variation is normal
• Big or sudden changes deserve attention

What’s common
Stress, travel, illness, breastfeeding, some medications, and weight changes can affect timing.

What to track in Lalin
• Period start dates (and end dates if known)
• Symptoms, mood, and major life changes

When to seek care
If your cycle becomes very unpredictable for several months, you miss periods and could be pregnant, or you have severe pain or heavy bleeding.

flowAndPeriodLength.title: Flow and period length: what’s typical?
flowAndPeriodLength.body:
TL;DR
• “Normal” is often your usual pattern
• Very heavy bleeding or dizziness is a red flag

What’s common
Flow and duration vary widely. Some cycles are lighter/heavier than others.

What to track in Lalin
• Flow level each day
• Pain, fatigue, and notes

When to seek care
If you soak through protection very quickly, pass very large clots, feel dizzy/faint, or bleeding disrupts daily life.

spottingAndBleeding.title: Spotting and bleeding between periods
spottingAndBleeding.body:
TL;DR
• Spotting can happen, but track it
• Heavy bleeding or pregnancy + bleeding can be urgent

What’s common
Hormonal changes, stress, some birth control methods, or pregnancy can cause spotting.

What to track in Lalin
• Date and amount of bleeding
• Pain, fever, dizziness, or unusual discharge

When to seek care
Urgently if bleeding is heavy, pain is severe, you faint, or you could be pregnant and have bleeding.

commonSymptoms.title: Common symptoms
commonSymptoms.body:
TL;DR
• Many symptoms cluster around periods
• Severe symptoms deserve evaluation

What’s common
Cramps, bloating, headaches, fatigue, acne, and mood changes can happen around your period.

What to try
• Rest, hydration, heat, gentle movement
• Track what helps you

When to seek care
If pain is severe, symptoms suddenly worsen, or they disrupt daily life.

whenToSeekCare.title: When to seek care
whenToSeekCare.body:
TL;DR
• Trust your instincts—severe or sudden changes matter

Consider medical care if you have
• Very heavy bleeding
• Fainting or severe dizziness
• Severe pain
• Bleeding between periods
• A sudden cycle change lasting multiple cycles
• Symptoms that disrupt daily life

Urgent care
Seek urgent help right away for heavy bleeding with fainting, severe pain, or pregnancy + bleeding.

dischargeBasics.title: Vaginal discharge: what’s normal vs concerning
dischargeBasics.body:
TL;DR
• Discharge changes across the cycle
• Bad smell, itching, pain, or fever can be concerning

What’s common
Discharge can vary by timing: clearer/stretchier near ovulation is common.

What to track in Lalin
• Color/texture changes, itching/burning
• Pain, fever, odor

When to seek care
If there’s strong bad smell, green/gray discharge, pelvic pain, fever, or burning/itching that doesn’t improve.

commonConditions.title: Common conditions: PCOS, fibroids, endometriosis
commonConditions.body:
TL;DR
• Some conditions can explain heavy bleeding or severe pain
• A clinician is needed for diagnosis

What to know
PCOS can be linked with irregular cycles and acne. Fibroids can cause heavy bleeding. Endometriosis can cause severe pelvic pain, often around periods.

What to track in Lalin
• Timing of pain, bleeding amount, symptoms
• How symptoms affect daily life

When to seek care
If pain is severe, bleeding is heavy, or symptoms limit daily life—bring your tracking history to your visit.

stiBasics.title: STI basics and when to test
stiBasics.body:
TL;DR
• Many STIs have no symptoms
• Testing is the only way to know

When to consider testing
• New partner or unprotected sex
• Unusual discharge, pelvic pain, sores
• Burning with urination
• Bleeding after sex

Safety note
If you feel unsafe or pressured, seek support from someone you trust.

fertileWindow.title: Fertile window basics
fertileWindow.body:
TL;DR
• Pregnancy is most likely near ovulation
• Apps estimate—they’re not perfect

What’s common
Fertile days often include the days leading up to ovulation and ovulation day.

What to do
If trying to conceive or avoid pregnancy, use reliable methods and consider clinician guidance.

contraception.title: Contraception and planning
contraception.body:
TL;DR
• There are many effective options
• The best method depends on your needs

What to know
Options include barrier methods, hormonal methods, and IUDs/implants.

What to do
If you can, talk with a clinician to choose what fits your health, budget, and preferences.

emergencyContraception.title: Emergency contraception (EC): quick basics
emergencyContraception.body:
TL;DR
• EC can reduce pregnancy risk after unprotected sex
• Sooner is usually better

What to do
Seek help as soon as possible. Availability varies by country and clinic.

Who can help
A clinician or pharmacist can explain options based on timing and your health.

tryingToConceive.title: Trying to conceive: tracking that helps
tryingToConceive.body:
TL;DR
• Timing matters, but bodies vary
• Tracking can help you notice patterns

What to track
• Period dates
• Cervical mucus changes
• Sex timing

When to seek care
If you’ve been trying for many months without success or you have irregular cycles, consider speaking with a clinician.

pregnancyBasics.title: Early pregnancy basics
pregnancyBasics.body:
TL;DR
• Symptoms can overlap with PMS
• A test is the best way to know

Possible early signs
Missed period, nausea, breast tenderness, fatigue, frequent urination.

When to seek care
Urgently for severe abdominal pain, fainting, or heavy bleeding if you could be pregnant.

sleepStress.title: Sleep and stress
sleepStress.body:
TL;DR
• Sleep and stress affect mood and energy
• Small routines add up

What to try
• Consistent sleep/wake time
• Breath work or prayer/meditation
• Short walks and light movement

When to seek care
If stress, anxiety, or low mood feels severe or lasts most days.

nutritionHydration.title: Nutrition and hydration
nutritionHydration.body:
TL;DR
• Food and water support energy
• Heavy bleeding can worsen fatigue

What to try
• Regular meals
• Iron-rich foods
• Enough water

When to seek care
If you feel unusually weak, dizzy, or short of breath—especially with heavy bleeding.

movementExercise.title: Movement and exercise across your cycle
movementExercise.body:
TL;DR
• Movement can help mood and cramps
• Adjust intensity by how you feel

What to try
Walking, stretching, yoga, and light strength work.

When to seek care
If exercise causes severe pain, dizziness, fainting, or unusual bleeding.

pmsMood.title: PMS, mood changes, and when it’s too much
pmsMood.body:
TL;DR
• PMS mood changes are common
• Severe or persistent symptoms deserve support

What to track in Lalin
• Mood changes and timing in your cycle
• Sleep, stress, and symptoms

When to seek care
If symptoms are severe, last most days, affect daily life, or you have thoughts of self-harm—seek help right away.

painRelief.title: Cramps and pain relief options
painRelief.body:
TL;DR
• Many self-care options can help
• Severe pain is not something to ignore

What to try
Heat, hydration, gentle stretching, rest.

Medicine note
Over-the-counter pain medicines may help, but options depend on your health.

When to seek care
If pain is severe, comes with fever, or prevents normal activities.
